tei:
<pb n="76"/>
N “Note from John Carter on <hi>Black Beauty</hi>,” <hi rend="bold">Antiquarian Bookman</hi> 10 (1952 [13 December]): 1724. Addition to Carter’s <hi>More Binding Variants</hi> (A:1938).<lb/>
D:1953<lb/>
L “Pricing a Book,” <hi rend="bold">Financial Times</hi>, 31 January 1953. On William Rees-Mogg’s essay on pricing.<lb/>
A “The Nomenclature of Nineteenth-Century Cloth Grains,” <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 2 (1953 [Spring]): 54-58. Signed by Carter and Michael Sadleir.<lb/>
A “The Rare Book Market,” <hi rend="bold">British Book News</hi>, May 1953, pp. 265-68.<lb/>
N “Thomas J. Wise’s Verses, 1882 & 1883,” <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 2 (1953 [Summer]): 158-59. Query 36.<lb/>
L “Helpful Publishers,” <hi rend="bold">The Bookseller</hi>, 14 November 1953. Thanks publishing trade for kindnesses to him the past seven years.<lb/>
D:1954<lb/>
O “E. P. Goldschmidt: A Personal Note,” <hi rend="bold">Antiquarian Bookman</hi> 13 (1954 [10 April]): 1076-77. Also published in Antiquarian Booksellers’ Association Newsletter.<lb/>
A [Detailed summary (but without quotations) of Carter’s talk on a panel on “Books and Freedom” at a meeting of the American Book Publishers Council, 6 May 1954], <hi rend="bold">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 165 (1954 [5 June]): 2453-54.<lb/>
A “Bibliography and the Rare Book Trade,” <hi rend="bold">Papers of the Bibliographical Society of America</hi> 48 (1954 [3rd Quarter]): 219-29. The offprint has changed pagination (pp. 3-13). Address delivered at the fiftieth-anniversary meeting of the Bibliographical Society of America, 22 May 1954. Reprinted in <hi rend="bold">The Bibliographical Society of America, 1904-1979: A Retrospective Collection</hi> (C:1980), pp. 307-17; four-paragraph excerpt reprinted in <hi rend="bold">Antiquarian Bookman</hi> 13 (1954 [5 June]): 1708.<lb/>
N [On Bruce Rogers], <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 3 (1954 [Autumn]): 168. Two unsigned paragraphs in the “Commentary” section. Identified by Carter in his set at the Library of Congress, with his initials in the margin.<lb/>
D:1955<lb/>
A “Eastward the Course of Empire?”, <hi rend="bold">Antiquarian Bookman Yearbook</hi>, 1955, pp. 9-10.<lb/>
L “Literary Treasures,” <hi rend="bold">The Times</hi>, 10 February 1955, p. 9. On the sale of the colored copy of <hi>Blake’s Jerusalem</hi> and the procedures for granting export licenses.<lb/>
A “The A. E. Housman Manuscripts in the Library of Congress,” <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 4 (1955 [Summer]): 110-14.<lb/>
R [Review of <hi>Book Collecting and Scholarship</hi> by Theodore C. Blegen et al.], <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 4 (1955 [Summer]): 177-78.<lb/>
A “Parkinson’s Law,” <hi rend="bold">The Economist</hi>, 19 November 1955, pp. 635-37. Unsigned.<lb/>
D:1956<lb/>
N [Advertisement for <hi>Sotheby’s</hi> by Carter reprinted], <hi rend="bold">The Book Collector</hi> 5 (1956 [Summer]): 109. Unsigned. Also reprinted in Dickinson (C:2004), p. 201.<lb/>
